missions.title: Sunday Night: Story Mission
missions.body: Sherlock Jones, brilliant amateur detective, has lately found himself attached to the biggest investigation of his generation. The Moridarty gang, founded by its namesake of mathematical fame, has maintained control of London's criminal organizations for nearly a decade. The results of their crimes are evident, yet the hands which weave those delicate webs have been nigh untraceable. Jones, true to his iron will, has persisted upon Moridarty's track and is even now constructing the evidence necessary for the common Englishman's jury. Unfortunately, the gang appears to have a multitude of trickery prepared for their final days. A wave of unprecedented violence has drowned the city; Smashed statuettes. Blackmails. Cannibalistic hysteria. Due to the very real and ever present threat, Scotland yard has made recent use of a private firm to assist in guarding the populace. This firm has become the frontline against Moridarty's outrage, but if Sherlock Jones' words are to be trusted, the gang's rampage is almost at an end. But until then, the firm must continue to stand tall against the tides of madness...

missions.title: Sunday Night: Non-Story Form
missions.body:
There are Quest Givers (mods) around academic side. When active, these Quest Givers will have a pink armband and an objective for humans to complete. When a quest is completed, that Quest Giver will deactivate and another Quest Giver will activate elsewhere.

Additionally, there are envelopes sealed with ORANGE tape. These contain currency, which must be brought to Tiger Statue to secure a stake in the black market. If the black market is not fully secured, you will not have access to the merchant in the future.

missions.title: Sunday Night: Non-Story Form
missions.body:
There are Quest Givers (mods) around academic side. When active, these Quest Givers will have a pink armband and an objective for humans to complete. When a quest is completed, that Quest Giver will deactivate and another Quest Giver will activate elsewhere.

One of these Quest Givers will be taggable during their quest. They will be wearing an extra green armband.

Additionally, there are envelopes sealed with GREEN tape. These contain currency, which must be brought to Tiger Statue to secure a stake in the black market. If the black market is not fully secured, you will not have access to the merchant in the future.

missions.title: Monday Night: Story Form
missions.body:
Now that the firm has established relations with London’s ordinary citizens, its actions can safely move to the criminal elements. Jones is enlisting a group of trusted colleagues specializing in espionage and pineapple bludgeonings. According to the captain’s instructions, these detectives arrive by the evening train and are entirely the firm’s responsibility once in the city’s borders. Operations will begin with the assembly of Dr. Watson’s Zetection™ devices, laying the groundwork for the echolocation of Moridarty’s foot soldiers.

It must also be noted that although the firm’s honour prevented you from properly consorting with a certain entirely legal business, he was eventually convinced that the law pays well enough to betray his organization.

missions.title: Monday Night: Story Form
missions.body:
With your black market contacts now secure, Moridarty has instructed that The Yard’s new hounds be made to understand that the organization’s health is as much in their best interest as it is yours. Those higher in the ranks, or who resist assimilation, are to be removed using all available resources.

In unrelated news, a shipment of protective gear has arrived from the European mainland. The nature of your current situation requires immediate use of this equipment, which will be dispatched by the local foreman at the next neighbourhood meeting.

missions.title: Monday Night: Non-Story Form
missions.body:
There are VIPs around campus, which become taggable when picked up. These VIPs must be escorted to a location, where you will need to locate materials. Once a VIP has all of their materials, they must be escorted to a final location where a Zetection™ device must be built and held while it powers up. Once the machine is calibrated, the VIP will despawn for a time before re-appearing at their original location. VIPs are not allowed inside, but can utilize safe zones.

The pickup locations for these VIPs are:

  • Gazebo
  • Skybridge
  • Behind Bausch & Lomb
  • Lowenthal Circle

Because you chose 'Reliable Railroads', the respawn timer for your VIPs has been shortened to 5 minutes (previously 8).

Merchant Prices:

Item Price
Elephant Blaster 2 Gems
Deployable Cover

1 Gem
Body Armour 3 Gems

missions.title: Monday Night: Non-Story Form
missions.body:
There are human VIPs around campus, which become taggable when picked up. When they are taggable, they will be wearing a green armband. These VIPs must be escorted to locations in order to build a Zetection™ device. After the device is completed or the VIP is tagged, the VIPs will despawn and re-appear after a time. VIPs are not allowed inside, but can utilize safe zones.

The potential destination locations for these VIPs are:

  • Greek Lawn
  • GV Volleyball Court
  • Pi Quad
  • Infinity Quad
  • In Front of Carlson
  • Kodak Quad
  • Bus Stop
  • Sentinel
  • Behind the SAU
  • Slaughter Quad (Destler-Johnson Quad)
  • Grassy Knoll
  • Greek Rock

Because you chose 'Armoured Hyenas', one of your jackals has been upgraded to a tank, and Tank shirts will be 1 gem cheaper until Wednesday night.

Merchant Prices:

Jackal 1
Tank 2 (33% off)
Boomer 5
Biocade 1
Snake Charmer 2

missions.title: Rules Reminder
missions.body:
This is just a reminder that hard tipped darts are illegal in our game.  Many aftermarket darts have legal tips but the process used to manufacture them means that some hard tipped darts may get mixed in. If you purchased darts that aren’t from a retail store, please check all the tips to make sure they compress when pushed down.

If you find any hard tipped darts during the game, please turn them in to a mod or admin.

Illegal darts will not have a hollow tip.

If you have any questions, please contact a mod or admin or email hvz@rit.edu!

missions.title: Tuesday Night: Story Form
missions.body: The Yard apparently doesn't realize we rule these streets, and we can't have that. Those devices from a mister Dr. Watson from last night have compromised our communication network among upper leadership. Moridarty's now sending messengers to make sure all the lieutenants stay up to date on his master plan, and it stays out of Scotland Yard's (and Jones's) prying eyes. Don't worry if you can't read the message - the gang doesn't need literacy.

missions.title: Tuesday Night: Story Form
missions.body:
Using Dr. Watson’s newly calibrated Zetection™ devices, Scotland Yard has Zetected™ several powerful entities around London. Unfortunately, the full array is not yet online and the exact location of these entities remains a mystery. Tonight, your firm has been dispatched to gather information regarding the activities of Moridarty’s men - by force if necessary.

The criminal organization is rather fond of a particular cipher, for which the Yard’s experts have all called in sick. Due to this complication any messages you might intercept will be nigh-impossible to understand. However, Sherlock Jones has stated his faith in your expertise, and assured you that any insight you obtain will be well rewarded.

missions.title: Tuesday Night: Non-Story Form
missions.body:
There will be ZVIPs around campus, denoted by blue mod bandanas and pink headbands. When these ZVIPs are stunned by humans, they will become a human objective where they were stunned for 8 minutes. During this time, humans will be attempted to crack coded messages.

If a ZVIP is not currently stunned by humans, you may escort the mod to another point. Once successfully escorted, the ZVIP will go on cooldown for 5 minutes. The points ZVIPs can be are:

  • Greek Rock
  • Slaughter Quad
  • Infinty Quad
  • Grassy Knoll
  • In front of Carlson
  • Bus Stop
  • Sentinel

****SOME OR ALL OF THESE LOCATIONS WILL CHANGE AT 10:00PM. YOUR MISSION TEXT WILL UPDATE TO REFLECT THE NEW LOCATIONS.****

Because you chose 'Diabolical Dispatch', there will be a witch spawning at Greek Rock. You will also receive a free Snake Charmer shirt.

Merchant Prices:

Item Price
Jackal 1
Tank 2 (33% off)
Snake Charmer 2
Boomer 5

missions.title: Tuesday Night: Non-Story Form
missions.body:
There will be ZVIPs around campus, denoted by blue mod bandanas and pink headbands. When these ZVIPs are stunned, they will become a human objective where they were stunned for 8 minutes. During this time, you will have to either solve a sudoku puzzle, or decode a ciphered message.

Zombies have the ability to escort these ZVIPs to other points; ZVIPs can be stunned while in transit. The points ZVIPs may be at are:

  • Greek Rock
  • Slaughter Quad
  • Infinty Quad
  • Grassy Knoll
  • In front of Carlson
  • Bus Stop
  • Sentinel

****SOME OR ALL OF THESE LOCATIONS WILL CHANGE AT 10:00PM. YOUR MISSION TEXT WILL UPDATE TO REFLECT THE NEW LOCATIONS.****

Because you chose 'Cast Iron Billy Clubs', the ZVIP stun timer has been extended to 8 minutes (previously 5).

Merchant Prices:

Item Price
Deployable Cover 1
Elephant Blaster 3
Body Armour 3
Witch Flare 1

missions.body:
There will be ZVIPs around campus, denoted by blue mod bandanas and pink headbands. When these ZVIPs are stunned by humans, they will become a human objective where they were stunned for 8 minutes. During this time, humans will be attempted to crack coded messages.

If a ZVIP is not currently stunned by humans, you may escort the mod to another point. Once successfully escorted, the ZVIP will go on cooldown for 5 minutes. The points ZVIPs can be are:

  • Greek Rock
  • Behind the SAU
  • Kodak Quad
  • Pi Quad
  • Behind Bausch & Lomb
  • Golisano/Orange Bike Rack
  • GV Statue

****IT IS NOW 10:00PM, AND SOME OF THESE LOCATIONS HAVE CHANGED. YOUR MISSION TEXT HAS UPDATED TO REFLECT THE NEW LOCATIONS.****

missions.title: Wednesday Night: Story Form
missions.body:
Alright everyone, we know that Scotland Yard has figured out we changed communication styles, and they can't keep up with that. The problem is, Moridarty likes logs of information, and it's all bein' passed by word of mouth now rather than the secret meetings. This means we got notetakers at each important meeting.

Problem is, a couple of 'em have gone on walkabout, and well, don't have it all there. We can't keep them in one spot, but you need to watch for any important info they might let slip. 

And as always, try to bring some of London's finest to see our point of view tonight.

missions.title: Wednesday Night: Story Form
missions.body: We've got Moridarty to fall back to in-person assurances and codes for any communication, and that'a win for us. However, we'll still watching out for any new information. A Mrs. Ann E Mouse gave us a tip - apparently the gang's notetakers have a habit of wandering about, and might let information slip right out of their hands while walking. We need to figure out what he's planning, and will take any edge. Get those notes to our experts!

missions.title: Wednesday Night: Non-Story Form
missions.body:
There will be two 'notetakers' draped in light rope, wandering campus, occasionally dropping notebooks. You may also hold these notetakers for 1 minute to make them drop an additional notebook. You must retrieve the notebooks labelled 'Human' and bring them to these locations:

  • Tunnel Between GV and S Lot
  • Pi Quad
  • Greek Rock

Once at a location, you must arrange the notebooks into their proper order, so that they form coherent sentences.

Because you chose 'Peaslee's Perception', the notebook's phrases will be simper and easier to piece together.

Merchant Prices:

Item Price
Deployable Cover 1
Elephant Blaster 2
Body Armour 3

missions.title: Wednesday Night: Non-Story Form
missions.body:
There will be two 'notetakers' draped in light rope, wandering campus and occasionally dropping notebooks. Humans must retrieve their notebooks and bring them to these locations:

  • Tunnel Between GV and S Lot
  • Pi Quad
  • Greek Rock

You must retrieve the notebooks labelled 'Zombie' and deliver them to Pi Quad. Once at a location, notebooks must be arranged into their proper order so that they form coherent sentences.

Because you chose ‘Falcon’s Grasp’, notetakers will drop human notebooks less frequently.

Merchant Prices:

Item Price
Jackal 1
Tank 2 (33% off)
Snake Charmer 2
Boomer 5
Deplorable Cover 3

missions.title: Thursday Night: Story Form
missions.body:
A'right ya gits, Moridarty's done dealin' with yer last contact. Notetakers literally dropping critical intelligence is just a failure to organize. We don't know how much that nosy Detective Jones has cracked, or what Dr. Watson's reading now. On top of all that, Scotland Yard is coming in hard. So Moridarty's ordered a major shift in how we do things. 

No more middlemen. The gang's got some undercover lieutenants scattered through London, and we need to ensure all of 'em are up to date on the plans. They might not open up at first, but I'm sure your group can figure it out. All of you are sma...well. Uh, at least functional. You lot gotta bring em together and ensure the proper, untranslated, unmanipulated orders get to the people who need to hear 'em. Don't worry, the boss figured out a way to make sure this happens on the move to keep everyone involved out of the Yard's prying hands.

missions.title: Thursday Night: Story Form
missions.body:
In the past week, Scotland Yard has obtained more information on Moridarty and his gang’s activity than they previously had in their entire archive. Thanks to Mr. Jones, the net is finally woven with which to capture the organization’s treacherous members. Yet even as it appears his finest hour approaches, Sherlock Jones has remained in a state of considerable agitation through most of the afternoon.

Jones only recently appeared at the station, sharing a brief conversation with the on-duty officers before heading out to make his own arrangements. You overheard very few of his commands, but you sense that a great task has been passed down to you and your compatriots. The last of winter’s gusts bellow in the street, as the captain calls the district to arms...

missions.title: Thursday Night: Non-Story Form
missions.body:
There are six witches wandering campus. Humans will be attempting to stun & capture these witches in order to bring them to either Lowenthal Circle or Slaughter Quad.

You will have a ‘car’ made of PVC. You may bring it in the vicinity of a witch in order to initiate meetings. When the first witch enters the car, you will have 3 minutes to finish collecting witches. Upon the second witch entering the car, you will have 4 minutes to find the last.

Once 3 witches are together in the car, they will begin a meeting, which will last 5 minutes. After this time, the witches will exit the car and will not be able to have another meeting for a while.

While witches are docile while in the car, if you take too long to form a meeting they will become impatient and exit the car, becoming aggressive for a short amount of time.

Additionally, the car is not invincible - if humans take control of the car (at least one human is in contact, and no zombies are), the car becomes a large hula hoop along with any witches inside. Humans may continue use of the car until you regain control of it.

Because you chose ‘Shining Sappers’, you will be granted a free Snake Charmer and two Witch Flares.

Merchant Prices:

Item Price
Jackal 1
Snake Charmer 2
Tank 3
Boomer 5
Deplorable 3
Biocade 2

Interaction notes:

A Witch Flare takes priority for a witch over them willingly entering the car. Any witches already in a hoop/car will ignore Witch Flares.

Snake charmed witches can be ordered to go into the car, but will have the same meeting rules as a normal witch.

Snake charmed witches that are captured will return to their snake charmer if they are freed within sight of their Snake Charmer.

Witches are effectively out of play while in a hoop/car. They cannot be stunned, and the Elephant Blaster has no effect.

missions.title: Thursday Night: Non-Story Form
missions.body:
There are six witches wandering campus. You will be attempting to stun & capture these witches with Hula Hoops in order to bring them to either Lowenthal Circle or Slaughter Quad. 

The starting locations of your Hoops will be Infinity Quad and Sentinel.

Zombies will have a 'car' made of PVC, which they can use to contain witches while the witches have 'meetings'. While witches are in the car, they are docile to both sides, but may become impatient if it takes too long to form a meeting.

Additionally, the car is not invincible - if you take control of the car (at least one human is in contact, and no zombies are), the car becomes a large hula hoop along with any witches inside. You may continue use of the car so long as you retain control of it.

Because you chose ‘Hunter's Hope’, you will be granted an additional Hoop and two free Witch Flares. The free hoop will be given out by your Merchant.

Merchant Prices:

Item Price
Deployable Cover 1
Elephant Blaster 2
Body Armour 3
Witch Flares 1

Interaction notes:

A Witch Flare takes priority for a witch over them willingly entering the car. Any witches already in a hoop/car will ignore Witch Flares.

Snake charmed witches can be ordered to go into the car, but will have the same meeting rules as a normal witch.

Snake charmed witches that are captured will return to their snake charmer if they are freed within sight of their Snake Charmer.

Witches are effectively out of play while in a hoop/car. They cannot be stunned, and the Elephant Blaster has no effect.

missions.title: Friday Night: Story Form
missions.body:
The Yard's been attacking us all week, breaking our communications, harassing our members, and even capturing some of our number. And now the bravest arm of the law plans to run? This will not do. The following orders come from Moridarty himself.

---

These "enforcers of the law" must pay for their intrusions. Just because they don't understand the purpose of our actions they seek to stop all my machinations? No, they must fail. Stop Scotland Yard's evacuation by any means necessary. Fear not, you do not act alone. Even now, our spies in the force are relaying information and plans for their escape from London. Expect these details within the next hour. If any word of my glorious plan gets out, this will all be for naught. Stop. Them. All. 

---

Well, you all have your orders. Round up your number, and get to it. Rumor has it Sherlock Jones has visited the London offices. He's a master of disguise and may be hidden - watch out for the wily bastard.

missions.title: Friday Night: Story Form
missions.body:
Through your efforts and those of Scotland Yard, many of the gang’s affiliates, from the nefarious plotters to the humble catburglar, were brought to chains last night and are currently being held across London. Unfortunately, several of the more dangerous members have evaded capture, along with Moridarty himself. As such you should be on your guard, for they will likely seek to enact revenge upon as many of the force as possible.

In other news, several of your superiors received a surprise visit at the firm’s Brixton headquarters this evening, by none other than Sherlock Jones himself. This is not terribly unusual, however he insisted on closing the shutters and proceeded to give a rather strange set of instructions, to be carried out at the end of today’s shift. A copy of these will likely reach you an hour after this one, as with your usual correspondence. As of this time you should only need to know that Mr. Jones has recommended a hearty supper, a warm coat, and the prompt evacuation of all our personnel from the city of London.

missions.title: Friday Night: Non-Story Form
missions.body:
In order to escape London, you must obtain a ticket, board the train (mods with flags), and successfully move from its final drop off point to a designated zone. The inside of the train is a safe zone; zombies may not enter, and humans cannot be tagged but may fire out.

To obtain a ticket, you must hold a terminal for an uninterrupted amount of time based on the amount of people the ticket will be for. Each terminal has a limited number of tickets; the mod will leave when their tickets runs out. Due to the zombie tier, you may only obtain tickets in multiples of four (i.e. 4 humans, 8 humans, etc). The locations of these terminals are:

  • Behind the SAU
  • Sentinel
  • Slaughter (Destler-Johnson) Quad
  • Pi Quad
  • Grassy Knoll

The train will be following a set path throughout the mission, and may only be boarded at designated stopping points. Here is the train’s (estimated) schedule. All times are PM Eastern. THE TRAIN DOES NOT PICKUP AT TIGER STATUE.

Location Arrival Departure
INACTIVE N/A 6:25
Kodak Quad 6:27 6:29
In Front of Carlson 6:31 6:33
Skybridge 6:36 6:38
Grassy Knoll 6:40 6:42
Tiger Statue 6:46 ???
UNDISCLOSED ??? ???
Tiger Statue ??? 6:55
Kodak Quad 6:57 6:59
In Front of Carlson 7:01 7:03
Skybridge 7:06 7:08
Grassy Knoll 7:10 7:12
Tiger Statue 7:16 ???
UNDISCLOSED ??? ???
Tiger Statue ??? 7:25
Kodak Quad 7:27 7:29
In Front of Carlson 7:31 7:33
Skybridge 7:36 7:38
Grassy Knoll 7:40 7:42
Tiger Statue 7:46 ???
UNDISCLOSED 7:55 END MISSION

Once the train arrives at a dropoff destination, all humans currently on the train must exit and reach a nearby zone in order to extract. These zones will be marked with stakes, rope, and moderators.

Because you chose “The Engineer’s Thumb”, you will receive a one-time use item that will force a train stop. This item can be picked up from your Merchant in the Gosnell Atrium.

Merchant Prices (only available in the first hour):

Item Price
Deployable Cover 1
Elephant Blaster 2
Body Armour 3
